snippet: The United Nations’ special representative on sexual violence in conflict zones said that rapes by armed men in South Sudan were widespread and intolerable.
abstract: Zainab Bangura of Sierra Leone, United Nations special representative on sexual violence in conflict zones, says that rapes by armed men in South Sudan are widespread and intolerable and have worsened after almost 10 months of conflict.
lead_paragraph: The United Nations’ special representative on sexual violence in conflict zones said that rapes by armed men in South Sudan were widespread and intolerable.

headline.main: South Sudan: U.N. Official Expresses Concern Over Level of Sexual Violence
headline.print_headline: South Sudan: U.N. Official Expresses Concern Over Level of Sexual Violence

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
